intro: Peristrophe namibiensis, commonly known as the Namibian grassveld grass, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Peristrophe namibiensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native range.
